# Pyre (Spell)
## Overview
[[Evocation Spells|Evocation]] \[[[Fire Spells|fire]]]

**Level:** [[3rd Level Sorcerer Spells|Sorcerer 3]], [[3rd Level Wizard Spells|Wizard 3]]

**BoXM:** [[BoXM 6th-Level Wizard Spells List|Wizard 6]]

**Casting Time:** 1 standard action

**Components:** V, S, M (a small cylinder of sulfur soaked in a drop of oil)

**Range:** Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels)

**Area:** One 5-foot square/level (S) 

**Duration:** Instantaneous

**Saving Throw:** None

**Spell Resistance:** Yes

**Source:** Dragonlance Campaign Setting (WotC), pg. 110

When you cast this spell, you summon gouts of flame from the ground, dealing 3d6 points of fire damage to all within the area of effect. In addition, any creature affected must succeed on a Reflex save or catch on fire.

**GM Note**

*House Rule:* Name changed from *Palin's pyre* to *pyre* for campaign continuity.

In the Dragonlance campaign, this spell was created by the sorcerer Palin when he was troubled by a group of goblins and has rapidly gained favor among sorcerers.
